title: What is Kylie Jenner’s Rise and Shine song?
text:
Stormi inspired her mum to get singing (Picture: Instagram/Kylie Jenner/Backgrid)

Kylie Jenner wasn’t previously known for her vocal range or lyrical talent, but that hasn’t stopped the beauty business mogul from turning a tune into dollar signs.

This week, Kylie’s singing talent has caught the attention of the internet and the Kardashian sister has found herself at the centre of a Twitter meme storm over a clip of her singing: ‘Rise and Shine’.

Mobilising at a speed that can only be attributed to a Kardashian who senses a money-making opportunity for merch, Kylie has already launched a range of Rise and Shine branded hoodies on her site, kyliejennershop.com.

But what is Kylie Jenner’s Rise and Shine song and is the lip kit creator swapping skincare for serenading fans instead?

What is Kylie Jenner’s Rise and Shine song?

The Kylie Jenner Rise and Shine internet phenomenon began after the 22-year-old shared a video on her YouTube channel where she gives a tour around her pink-themed office in LA.

Advertisement

Advertisement

At the end of the tour video, which has currently amassed 9,574,892 views on YouTube at time of writing, Kylie enters her daughter’s room (because when you’re Stormi Webster you get your own special space and playroom at your mom’s office) and wakes her up from a nap.

It all started when Kylie woke Stormi up from a nap (Picture: YouTube)

As she turns the light on, Kylie sings ‘rise and shine!’ to her daughter. And so Kylie Jenner’s singing career was born.

The clip of Kylie singing rise and shine was very swiftly given the meme treatment by her fans, before being picked up across the internet and turning the brief song into a viral sensation.

‘Kylie singing “rise and shine” had truly changed me in ways I cannot explain,’ one fan quipped with another adding: ‘I cannot stop thinking about the video of legendary and incomparable vocalist Kylie Jenner singing “rhiiiiiseee and shiiiiiine”.’

Kylie began reacting to the memes, clearly thinking they were hilarious, before celebrity pals of hers such as Miley Cyrus got in on the action, sharing their own takes on the Kylie Jenner Rise and Shine and meme.

Reacting to the clip, singer Ariana Grande even posted a video of herself singing Kylie’s rendition of Rise and Shine, with the caption: ‘@kyliejenner can i sample [sic].’

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Kylie immediately gave Ariana the go ahead and replied: ‘Yes, yes you can @arianagrande. As long as I’m in music video.. [sic].’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Proving that things had escalated even further, Kylie later shared a clip of her daughter Stormi dancing around at home to a remixed version of Rise and Shine on her phone.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

‘You like it?’ Kylie laughs in the video, ‘That’s mommy!’

Stormi however was less than sure if she does actually like it and promptly asks Kylie to put on ‘Daddy singing’ instead, clearly preferring the vocal stylings of her multi-award winning, SICKO MODE singer, songwriter and rapper father, Travis Scott.

description: Kylie Jenner wasn’t previously known for her lyrical talent but that hasn’t stopped the mogul from turning Rise and Shine into dollar signs.
